Replies.Reply: by  Eric Bernt  THIRD REWRITE   August 24, 1994   Two men bolt recklessly through a downtown street. Hunters hot on the trail of their prey in an urban jungle.
His body is a running back's. His endurance a marathoner's. His face one you'd want for your own. He's in his 30s. If he was in his 20s, you'd still be jealous.
I can't get over how different you look.
Lady, move!
Five years can be a bitch, huh?
Where's John?
Recital's over, asshole.
SHIT!
SOMEBODY.. .DO SOMETHING!
He...only had a year left on his sentence.
Why'd.. .you pull me out?
He was a computer program for crissake.
Real, my ass. It's an overblown game.
Anybody ever catch that fucking psycho?
I'm getting by.
You want to know how I'm doing?
But with the six months off I get for being your guinea pig, I've only got to survive another 17 years, 5 months, and 23 days.
You know those cheesy Christmas cards of your family under that tree in your back yard you keep sending me every year?
OW!
It'll never feel right.
Sometimes.
whose wrists and ankles are cuffed, being led into a Prison Interrogation Room. Dr. Madison Carter sits at a table, a VISITOR'S BADGE clipped to her suit. A notepad in front of her.
You actually listen to all those tapes?
A little less than yesterday.
John died.
nothing more than a lab rat to you.
If I had died yesterday, you'd have already dissected my brain and analyzed it to see if I carry any genetic predisposition toward violence.
Not much. He was just a computer program. Nothing more.
Go to hell.
Enough!
I don't have to do anything except survive. And it's taking everything I've got just to do that.
You're wasting your time.
It's too early in the morning for me to be cordial. You got any coffee?
Only because I got pulled out early.
I've seen worse.
Jesus Christ.
Can you kill it?
Not from in here.
What happens if I can't catch him?
How do you know I won't run?
being given a crew cut by an INMATE BARBER inside the Prison Barber Shop. Long lengths of Parker's hair cover the floor.

putting on his L. A. P. D. uniform and badge inside a Prison Interrogation Room. He looks very much like he did in virtual reality, except for the scar on his cheek, and his empty holster. Cox and Madison look on.
What she's going to do is get in my way.
She wasn't part of the deal, Cox.
Their weapons missing?
Where's my gun?
Every day for the last five years, I told myself someday I would be out here again. No more bars. No more guards. No more fights just to stay alive.
Every day for the last five years, I told myself that lie.
Every time I said it, it was. I never really thought I was going to make it.
Fine. Never felt better in my life.
See, I'm a good liar.
Don't worry. If I can't handle it, I'll just kill everybody.

anything, make sure I'm nowhere near it.

For murder, though it have no tongue, will speak with most miraculous organ.
Hamlet.
Creating a whole far more dangerous than the sum of its parts.
This is getting you pumped up, isn't it? This is like the World Series to you.

anybody else.

Give me a goddam break. I'm not going to go anywhere alone.
Told you I wasn't going to go anywhere.
Sometimes, I like being part machine.

Want to tell me the real reason we stopped at your house?

way of saying you have no idea what to do next.

Tell him.

Still got your gun?

Nail the fucker.

hesitates at the escalator leading to the south-bound side of the tracks.
peeking out from behind the pillar on the south-bound platform.
moves toward the edge of the platform, aiming his gun across the tracks. Those around him quickly back away.
Everybody get down!
GET DOWN!!!
doesn't hesitate. He lines up his shot and pulls the trigger.
fires again. Repeatedly. Moving closer and closer to the edge of the platform, trying to get a better angle while he still has a shot.
Sid's getting away.
If you're gonna do it, better do it now.
I lost him...

The man who killed my wife...who killed my daughter...who ruined my life used to taunt me with that line...

God, you fucking know-it-all!
tell me! Why?! Were you afraid I'd lose it?! Go over the edge?! Huh?!

You...mother...fucker! I'M GOING TO KILL YOU!!!
GRIMES, YOU'RE DEAD!
DEAD! YOU HEAR ME?
You really are pathetic, you know that? Mathew Grimes is only one letter in my alphabet. He is nothing compared to me.
Shit!
They're going to fry me for it, anyway.
let them put the implant in my head? How?
entire time? Can you give me one good reason why I shouldn't kill you right now?

I pose an unacceptable danger to the public, remember?

puts down his binoculars. Madison does not.
See something?
Nice work.

NOOOOOO!
Don't worry, I know. I know.

criminal psychology expert has helped me understand what I'm capable of. And what I'm not.

My...secret.
Don't move, and don't make a sound.

You are going after Mayor Bennett.

sitting precariously on the increasingly-uneven roof of the Hollywood Tower in virtual reality. Unable to break free of his binds, he rocks the chair onto its side.
MADISON!!!
hanging on by his fingertips to the bulbous roof of the Hollywood Tower. He's going to fall at any second.

finally losing his grip on the roof of the Hollywood Tower in virtual reality. He plummets with accelerating speed.
...I think so...You?
Lindenmeyer?
Sid?
Elizabeth Deane, please. Tell her it's Parker Barnes...
Trying to find out where the bomb is. Where the hell have you been?

Have the demo teams check every subway tunnel, water pipe, gas pipe, and sewer pipe that goes under, over, or into the arena.
You're the highest law enforcement official in the country. Use the fucking army if you need to.
Or what, you'll authorize my death a second time today?
kill you.

I'm sorry, I thought you were somebody else.
Jesus Christ.
I know who the dominant personality is.
Lindenmeyer.
Where the hell are you going?

BARNES, YOU'RE DEAD!

Then shoot him already.

million developing is a very expensive way to control the prison population.

organism.

trap. What's your point, Dr.

I should have never tried to solve one problem by allowing the creation of another.

Lindenmeyer developed neural connectors that tap directly into the nervous system. If the simulator isn't calibrated properly, experiencing death in this level of VR is like experiencing death within a dream.

official in the country.

To the first LETAC engineer to go into production on prototypes.
